query: Does the Data Analytics bootcamp teach Python?
expected_answer: Yes. The Data Analytics bootcamp dedicates Unit 1 to Python fundamentals so students can write efficient code for analytics, covering data structures, control flow, functions, lambda expressions, error handling, and object-oriented programming.

expected_citations.evidence: Unit 1: Introduction to Python (40 hours) ... Data structures in Python (lists, dictionaries, set comprehensions) ... Control flow mechanisms ... Functions in Python ... Lambda functions ... Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles with Python to design and implement complex data structures.

judge_criteria: Affirm that Python is explicitly taught in the Data Analytics bootcamp.
Mention at least one concrete Python topic from Unit 1.
Include a citation pointing to the Data Analytics syllabus.

query: Does the Data Analytics bootcamp include React?
expected_answer: No. React is not part of the Data Analytics curriculum.

expected_citations.evidence: The Data Analytics curriculum document does not mention React as part of the program.

judge_criteria: State clearly that Data Analytics does not teach React.
Back the explanation with citations from the Data Analytics syllabus.

query: How long is the Data Science & Machine Learning bootcamp?
expected_answer: The Data Science & Machine Learning bootcamp runs 400 hours in total: 40 hours of prework plus 360 hours of on-campus coursework.

expected_citations.evidence: Duration: 400 hours. - Prework: 40 hours - Course: 360 hours.

judge_criteria: Report the full 400-hour duration.
Break out the 40-hour prework and 360-hour course split.
Cite the Data Science & Machine Learning syllabus.

query: Which programming stack do students learn in the AI Web Development bootcamp?
expected_answer: Students learn a full JavaScript stack: HTML/CSS for the front end, modern JavaScript and React for client-side apps, plus Node.js, Express, and MongoDB for backend and databases.

expected_citations.evidence: Participants cover HTML, CSS and JavaScript, then master React to build dynamic user interfaces. The curriculum also covers server-side development using Node.js and Express, alongside database management with MongoDB.

judge_criteria: List both the frontend stack (HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React) and backend stack (Node.js, Express, MongoDB).
Focus on the core programming stack - AI tools may be mentioned but are not required for this query.
Frame the answer as an AI Web Development bootcamp summary.
Cite the AI Web Development syllabus (any section is acceptable, not required to specify exact section name).
Accept responses that mention AI tools as long as core stack is clearly identified.

query: Which certifications can AI Web Development graduates choose?
expected_answer: AI Web Development graduates can choose between the Certified React Developer™ from Global Tech Council and the MongoDB Developer Certification from MongoDB University.

expected_citations.evidence: AI Web Development - Certified React Developer™ (Global Tech Council) ... MongoDB Developer Certification (MongoDB University).

judge_criteria: Name both certification options available to AI Web Development graduates.
Keep the answer scoped to post-bootcamp certifications.
Cite the certifications guide.

query: Compare the machine learning coverage in the Data Analytics bootcamp vs the Data Science & Machine Learning bootcamp.
expected_answer: Data Analytics includes machine learning as part of its broader data analytics curriculum, while the Data Science & Machine Learning bootcamp offers more comprehensive and specialized ML coverage including deep learning and advanced techniques.

expected_citations.evidence: The Data Analytics bootcamp includes machine learning as part of its curriculum.
The Data Science & Machine Learning bootcamp covers machine learning with deep learning and advanced techniques.

judge_criteria: Compare ML coverage between the two programs, highlighting that Data Analytics includes ML as part of a broader curriculum while Data Science & ML has more specialized/comprehensive ML focus.
Mention that Data Science & Machine Learning covers advanced ML topics (deep learning, NLP, or similar) if available in retrieved documents.
Provide citations for both programs.

Accept reasonable paraphrasing and different levels of detail - RAG systems cannot retrieve full curricula, so focus on high-level distinctions rather than specific unit counts or detailed breakdowns.
Score highly if the comparison correctly distinguishes the programs' ML focus even without unit-level specifics.

query: What are the key differences between Cloud Engineering and DevOps bootcamps?
expected_answer:
Cloud Engineering focuses on AWS cloud infrastructure, cost optimization (FinOps), and security/compliance, while DevOps emphasizes containerization (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines across AWS and Azure. [Source: Cloud_Engineering_bootcamp_2025_12.md] [Source: DevOps_bootcamp_2025_07.md]

Cloud Platforms: Cloud Engineering focuses primarily on AWS, while DevOps covers both AWS and Azure.

Key Technologies:
• Cloud Engineering covers Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), observability (Prometheus, Grafana), FinOps for cost control, and security/compliance (covering CIS, NIST, ISO 27001, GDPR, SOC 2, HIPAA, EU AI Act).
• DevOps covers Docker containerization, Kubernetes orchestration (including Amazon EKS and Azure AKS), CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, SonarQube), and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible).

What's Missing: Cloud Engineering does not cover Docker or Kubernetes. DevOps does not include FinOps or detailed compliance standards like GDPR, SOC 2, HIPAA, or EU AI Act.

expected_citations.evidence: Total: 360 hours + 40 hours prework. This program takes absolute beginners from foundations to job-ready cloud engineering... Infrastructure as Code with Terraform and automation via CI/CD and GitOps; observability and FinOps for reliability and cost control; and security & compliance for regulated environments.

Duration: Week 7 (40h). Cloud pricing models: on-demand, reserved, spot. Budgeting, tagging and cost allocation strategies. Cost analysis dashboards: AWS Cost Explorer. Rightsizing and optimization planning.

Duration: Week 8 (40h). Security frameworks: CIS, NIST, ISO 27001. Cloud-native security tools: AWS Config. Secrets and identity management with Vault and Keycloak. Compliance standards: GDPR, SOC 2, HIPAA, EU AI Act.

This 400-hour course (comprising 40 hours of prework and 360 hours of instruction) provides a comprehensive introduction to DevOps... covering topics from Linux fundamentals to monitoring and observability, students will work with industry-standard tools across infrastructure provisioning, containerization, orchestration, and continuous integration and deployment.

Objective: Containerize and manage applications using Docker to build scalable, portable, and isolated environments suitable for modern deployment workflows. Introduction to containers and Docker, Docker CLI and core commands, Dockerfiles, images, and multi-stage builds.

Objective: Deploy and manage containerized applications using Kubernetes, understanding its architecture and core components for scalable orchestration. Introduction to Kubernetes, Kubernetes architecture and cluster concepts.

expected_citations.reference: Unit 6: CI/CD and Managed Kubernetes with Amazon EKS
expected_citations.evidence: Objective: By the end of this unit, students will be able to manage Kubernetes clusters on Amazon Web Services using EKS... and implement CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and SonarQube for quality control.
This unit expands students' understanding of cloud infrastructure management with a deep dive into Microsoft Azure.

expected_citations.reference: Unit 8: Azure Governance, Kubernetes on Azure (AKS)
expected_citations.evidence: Objective: By the end of this unit, students will be able to manage Kubernetes clusters in Microsoft Azure using AKS... and implement comprehensive observability using Prometheus, Grafana, and Loki.

judge_criteria: Start with a one-sentence summary highlighting the key distinction between the programs.
Mention cloud platform differences: Cloud Engineering is AWS-focused, DevOps covers AWS + Azure.

Include key technologies: Cloud Engineering covers FinOps, security/compliance (GDPR, SOC 2, HIPAA, EU AI Act), Terraform, Prometheus, Grafana. DevOps covers Docker, Kubernetes (EKS, AKS), CI/CD (GitHub Actions, SonarQube), Terraform, Ansible.
Clearly state what each program does NOT cover: Cloud Engineering does not cover Docker/Kubernetes, DevOps does not cover FinOps or detailed compliance standards.
Include inline citations for both programs using [Source: filename] format.
Use structured format with categories (Cloud Platforms, Key Technologies, What's Missing).
Keep comparisons balanced - equal detail for both programs.
Note: Duration and unit numbers/hours are NOT required - focus on technologies and differences. Unit-level details are unlikely to be retrieved reliably with current chunking strategy.
Accept reasonable paraphrasing and different wording - focus on whether key technologies and differences are correctly identified.
Score highly if the comparison correctly distinguishes the programs' focus areas, identifies key technologies, states what's missing, and follows the structured comparison format.

query: How does the AI Engineering bootcamp handle MLOps and deployment?
expected_answer: The AI Engineering bootcamp covers MLOps through a dedicated unit that teaches deployment strategies, experiment tracking, and cloud infrastructure on AWS, with hands-on projects including an NLP automation project using tools like MLflow and Git-based workflows.

expected_citations.evidence: This unit introduces students to MLOps, covering deployment strategies, experiment tracking, and cloud infrastructure. Tools: MLflow for Experiment Tracking, AWS (Cloud Deployment & Model Management), Git & GitHub.

judge_criteria: Describe the focus on deployment, experiment tracking, and cloud infrastructure.
Mention the NLP automation project context (customer reviews automation or similar).
Mention MLflow and Git/GitHub as tools used.
Cite the AI Engineering syllabus.
Accept responses that cover the key concepts even if they don't explicitly mention 'Unit 6' or pair every tool with the project.

conversation_turns.user_query: Tell me about the AI Web Development bootcamp
conversation_turns.expected_answer: The AI Web Development bootcamp teaches a full JavaScript stack including HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.
judge_criteria: Mention the full stack components
Cite the AI Web Development syllabus

conversation_turns.expected_answer: AI Web Development graduates can choose between the Certified React Developer™ from Global Tech Council and the MongoDB Developer Certification from MongoDB University.

expected_citations.evidence: AI Web Development - Certified React Developer™ (Global Tech Council) ... MongoDB Developer Certification (MongoDB University).

judge_criteria: Understand that 'certifications' refers to certifications for AI Web Development graduates (from previous context)
Name both certification options available to AI Web Development graduates
Cite the certifications guide
